free_txt: M.M.
M.M. Ref. J,NSTP,1,69,2011 was added.
Authors' names were added. BIB information was added.
Subents 007-009 were added.
Request of data was sent to author Shusuke Hirayama
hirayama@aees.kyushu-u.ac.jp 18-07-2011.
SD: Headings and units to col. 3 were
added in Subents 5,6. Title corrected according to
first ref.

bib_record.title: Production of protons, deuterons, and tritons from carbon bombarded by 175 MeV quasi mono-energetic neutrons

free_txt: C data as plots of particle
double-differential yield.
First author  M.Hayashi.
Two measurements for carbon
First author M.Hayashi. Preliminary results.
Gustav Werner cyclotron.
Events in deltaE-E bands were fitted with respect to
the energy deposited in two deltaE detectors, which was
determined from thickness and energy loses calculated
by SRIM code.
Measured TOF data were used for selection of light-ion
events induced by neutrons in the main peak of source
neutron spectrum.
Number of net counts due to np scattering was obtained
using measurements of the (n,P) spectrum at 20 degrees
for both samples -CH2 and C.
Absolute values of c-s were determined using reference
np cross section in the same method as in REL-REFs of
U.Tippawan+. The np scattering cross sections from
NN-online of SAID Nucleon-Nucleon scattering database.
http://gwdac.phys.gwu.edu - G.Washington Un., USA.
Background was subtracted after normalization to the
same neutron fluence.
For finite efficiency of CsI(Tl) scintillator by Monte
Carlo simulation method.
For the finite target thickness by method of REL-REF
U.Tippawan+,J,PR/C,69 -not applied for 175 MeV .
It was assumed that target is treated as a point source
-it was confirmed by comparison of PHITS simulation
between a point source and a plane source, in which the
difference is only 1.%.
MEDLEY consists of eight
three-element telescopes mounted inside vacuum chamber
of 90 cm diameter.Each telescope consists of two fully
depleted silicon surface barrier detectors ( first of
thickness 50-60 microm, 23.9 mm diameter, second -
400-600 microm, 23.9 mm diameter)
serving as deltaE detector and CsI(Tl) scintillator
100 mm total length, cylindrical shape of 50 mm
diameter; last 30 mm are tapered to 18 mm diameter to
match size of Hamamatsu S3204-08 photodiode, serving as
E detector.
Energy calibration of detectors was obtained using the
data themselves.
Gustav Werner cyclotron.
Enriched 99.99% Li-7 target.
Neutrons transported to MEDLEY chamber through 100-cm
long conical collimator of 54 mm diameter at the end.
Faraday  cap - to monitor proton beam current.
Distance from Li target to the center of MEDLEY chamber
180 MeV protons produce neutrons with peak energy of
175 MeV using 23.5 mm thick Li target.
Neutron flux 4.3E+4 n/(cm**2*sec), proton beam
intensity 0.3 microA.
Measured (from data analysis of recoil protons from np
scattering in CH2 measurement) and calculated incident
neutron spectrum is presented on Fig.7 of C,2007NICE.
deltaE - E technique.
Used to reject the tail neutrons produced in Li
target.
For neutron spectrum, using CH2
target and kinematics calculation.
n,p scattering c-s were taken from NN-online SAID:
SAID Nucleon-Nucleon scattering database -
http://gwdac.phys.gwu.edu/
Details of Uppsala neutron beam facility.
Exp. setup of MEDLEY .
Three references for data reduction procedure.
Polyethylene (CH2) sample of 25 mm diameter, 1.0 mm
thickness - for absolute cross section normalization.
Instrumental background was measured without samples.
Request for the data was sent 03.07.2009 to
Y.Watanabe (Subents 002-006)
Detail of data analysis and model calculation - see
REL-REF of P.A.Soederstroem .
Digitizing error of E .
Digitizing error of DATA .
Error bar for DATA.
Relative neutron beam intensity was monitored by
integrated proton beam current and by both thin film
breakdown counter and ionization chamber .
98.5 MeV protons produce neutrons with peak energy
94 MeV using lithium target of 8 mm thick.
Neutron flux 3.1E+5 n/(cm**2*sec), proton beam
intensity of 3.4 microA.
Calcium sample of 29 mm diameter, 230 microm thickness.
